title: [Large-Scale] Customized Mobile Microlearning Course for Gen Z Nursing Education: Mathematical Modeling-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational nursing knowledge and professional experience, basic statistical analysis (mean/variance), graph interpretation skills, and understanding of linear regression and probability distributions (normal/Poisson)
context.additional_context: Customized educational program for workers aged 40+ reflecting the characteristics of Gen Z nursing learners and the educational needs of digital native generations. Application of probabilistic distribution modeling (Bayesian networks) for learning data analysis and t-test/chi-square test methods for verifying educational effectiveness.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the learning curve of educational content reflecting Gen Z learners' preference for digital environments using exponential and logistic curve modeling.
Learners can develop learning effectiveness optimization equations (e.g., linear programming) and time allocation algorithms (e.g., dynamic programming) using mobile-based microlearning strategies.

Learners can establish an A/B test experimental design that verifies the statistical significance (p-value < 0.05) of customized teaching methods considering generational trait differences and improves educational satisfaction by 15%.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
